alert.note: Alert for Custer; Washita (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 08 at 8:13PM CDT until June 09 at 3:46PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Washita River near Clinton affecting Washita and Custer Counties.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC039-149-091315- /O.EXT.KOUN.FL.W.0009.000000T0000Z-220609T2046Z/ /CLIO2.2.ER.220608T1320Z.220608T1730Z.220609T1446Z.NO/ 813 PM CDT Wed Jun 8 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Washita River near Clinton. * WHEN...Until tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 21.0 feet, Approximately 5 thousand acres of rural lands are covered by depths up to 3 feet... from areas near the mouth of Barnitz Creek... to near Clinton in Custer County... and downstream to near the town of Cloud Chief in Washita County. Depths may be greater at locations where small streams enter the Washita River valley below Clinton. Some farmsteads are flooded and others isolated by water over local roads. Low farm levees may be overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 21.2 feet. - Forecast...The Washita River is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
